body: @ewencp @kkonstantine for review
LGTM. Thanks for the patch!
@ijuma any thoughts?
Looks like now there is a conflict with 86aa0eb0f274c6e44eb190ce250433419e011a67.  Going to resolve it and push again.
LGTM
One last minor comment, and otherwise LGMT
@rhauch @hachikuji for review

I'm not convinced that this new logic is equivalent. Before, the checking of whether the schema is optional or has a default occurred only after the method checks whether there is a schema. Now, that logic is performed earlier when it is not certain there will be a schema.
@rhauch updated, thanks for reviewing

1. I ran the following command and it's weird to see a user level only config in the output.

bin/kafka-configs.sh --zookeeper localhost:2181 --describe --entity-type users --entity-type clients
Configs for user-principal 'junrao' are producer_byte_rate=100
Configs for user-principal 'junrao', client-id 'client1' are producer_byte_rate=300
1. If I add a client + user default config and run the command again, it's weird to see an empty default user-principal in the output.

Configs for default user-principal are 
Configs for default user-principal, client-id 'client1' are producer_byte_rate=300
Configs for user-principal 'junrao' are producer_byte_rate=100
Configs for user-principal 'junrao', client-id 'client1' are producer_byte_rate=300
@rajinisivaram : Thanks for the patch. I left a few minor comments. Once they are addressed, I can merge the PR in.
LGTM, thanks for the PR. :)
This is now fixed in a different PR.

@junrao Thank you for the review. I was thinking that it would be useful to have one kafka-configs describe command that described user as well as all the clients under it. But as you have pointed out, it is not very intuitive. So I have changed the command to list only <user, client> when both user and client types are specified. 

Have addressed all the other comments too. Thanks.
@shikhar, this looks good.

This PR is complete, so @nepal, can you please remove the WIP from the PR title and update the PR description to be up to date? The PR title and description became the commit message of the squashed commit that gets merged.

Also, when I ran the following command,

bin/kafka-configs.sh --zookeeper localhost:2181 --describe --entity-type users

I got the following. 

Configs for default user-principal are 
Configs for user-principal 'junrao' are producer_byte_rate=100

Could we not show "Configs for default user-principal" if it's empty?
@junrao Thanks again. Have fixed the --describe for users.
Thanks for the latest patch. Made a pass on the server side changes. They look good to me. Just a couple of minor comments, both can be addressed in a followup patch if needed.
@rajinisivaram : Thanks a lot for the patch. LGTM
@nepal @ijuma Fantastic work on this KIP! I left a couple minor comments which can be addressed in a followup (if needed). Overall, LGTM.
@shikhar Good catch! Minor comment on testing, but otherwise LGTM.

The failures are unrelated since we only changed a system test. I paste them below as they are for queryable state:

``` text
org.apache.kafka.streams.integration.QueryableStateIntegrationTest.shouldBeAbleToQueryState[0]
org.apache.kafka.streams.integration.QueryableStateIntegrationTest.queryOnRebalance[1]
```

cc @dguy
Thanks, merged to trunk and 0.10.0 branches.
Thanks for the PR @hachikuji, LGTM. Did you test that these fail without your fix for KAFKA-4160?
Review by @gwenshap, cc @arrawatia

One failure in the system test run:

test_id:    2016-09-17--001.kafkatest.tests.connect.connect_distributed_test.ConnectDistributedTest.test_bounce.clean=True
https://jenkins.confluent.io/job/system-test-kafka-branch-builder/549/console

It looks unrelated as we had the same failure in trunk recently (http://confluent-kafka-system-test-results.s3-us-west-2.amazonaws.com/2016-09-17--001.1474133882--apache--trunk--ecc1fb1/report.html).

The Jenkins PR builder timed out after 180 minutes while running a Streams test, but all client and core tests passed (I've restarted the build). The tests passed locally.
Another thing that maybe ideal to have is that if the ListOffsetRequest is from a consumer, we should only consider offsets up to the high watermark, instead of the log end offset.

@junrao Thanks for the review. I updated the patch to address your comments. The logic of returning only up to high watermark is already in `KafkaApis.handleOffsetRequestV1()`. I am not sure if we still target this for 0.10.1.0 release. So the ApiVersion may subject to change depending on the decision. Thanks.
@dguy In that case, won't a `TaskAssignmentException("failed to find an assignable client");` gets thrown since the `state == null`.
@dguy Just pushed the changes. it is ready for your review.
Review by @hachikuji
See discussion in PR #1350.
@enothereska @guozhangwang @mjsax - the test has been failing occasionally in the build.
@hjafarpour i'm confused - this looks like it has a-lot of changes that are unrelated to the task. 266 files changed and +10,326 lines.
Good catch, LGTM.
Looks like the merge has gone bad, would it be worth doing in another branch?
The test failure in the jenkins build will be fixed by: https://github.com/apache/kafka/pull/1845
@hachikuji thanks for review. Updated. PTAL again.

From the above mentioned PR,

> > PlainSaslServer is an internal implementation class and shouldn't really be extended. It could in theory be changed at any time, breaking subclasses which rely on it.

By having password verifier as an injectable dependency, the need to extend `PlainSaslServer` is no longer there. `PlainSaslServer` could be changed any time. Users just have to provide a SaslPasswordVerifier implementation and rest everything is usable from `PlainSaslServer`. So what essentially this patch does is to give people the control to plug their own password verifier.
@rajinisivaram @ijuma
LGTM. We need more logging, thanks.
Thanks for the feedback. I've updated the PR and moved the offset validation on the client side. I've also added a check for offsets larger than the current position.
LGTM. Merged to trunk.

You are right. Thanks for the patience!

Merged to trunk.

@dguy @enothereska Yes, there were many files from other commits and as Eno said it's merge problem. I'll create a new branch and add the changes there as Eno suggested. This should fix the merge issue. Will ping you when it is ready.
@ijuma Thanks for reviewing! I did verify that the revocation test fails prior to 4160. The other test passes since we were already covering that case, but I couldn't find a test case for it.
LGTM and merged to trunk. Thanks.

@vahidhashemian I'm still a little unsure about the right way to go here. The problem with my suggestion of switching to "round-robin,range" and finally just to "round-robin" is that the user won't be able to skip releases (which we have tried to allow up to this point). In that case, maybe we're better off just jumping straight to "round-robin" only. Perhaps we could make the switch to round-robin directly, but give users an "--upgrade" flag which enables both range and round-robin. What do you think?
@shikhar looks great to me. thanks for the fixes!
LGTM
@rajinisivaram : Thanks for the patch. LGTM

@hachikuji Would it be possible to keep the "roundrobin,range" assignment configuration for a few releases so chances of skipping releases causing issues with MM are reduced? Or we don't want to keep it around for long because of the overhead that comes with specifying multiple assignment?
LGTM. Merged to trunk.
Thanks @shikhar. Merged to trunk.
think i got em all
Thanks @rhauch. I cherry-picked into 0.10.0 (along with @shikhar's fixes). Would you mind closing this?
LGTM. Thanks for taking care of this!

@vahidhashemian Yeah, the extra overhead makes me a little uncomfortable. Maybe the warning message for this release should simply inform users that "round-robin" will usually provide better load balancing and that it will become the default in the future. Then we can decide later whether we want to provide a nicer upgrade path. What do you think?
The other thing I was thinking about is whether we ought to provide an "--assignment-strategy" option to make it easier for users to change.

@hachikuji That's fine with me. I could change the warning message back to the previous version.
Introducing an `--assignment-strategy` option sounds like a great idea too. I can open a JIRA for this improvement. Sounds good?
Yes, that sounds fine to me. Not sure if @ijuma has any thoughts.
@rajinisivaram : Thanks for the patch. Were you able to run the system tests with this patch?
LGTM

The Jenkins failure seems to be related to #1845 such that `StreamsMetadata.NOT_AVAILABLE` can now be returned and is not handled gracefully, and it is not related to this PR. I'll let @dguy to investigate further separately.

This patch LGTM and merged to trunk.
@benstopford Just to clarify, it looks like the test `FetcherTest.testFetcher` was mistakenly altered to use acks=0 in the patch for KIP-73. Is that right?
@becketqin I'd like to merge this before cutting the release branch. We can add additional testing in a followup if that will speed things up.
This was replaced with "KAFKA-4060: Remove zk client dependency in kafka streams #1884"
@hachikuji Sounds good to me. I have updated the patch to address the exiting comments.
@becketqin LGTM. Thanks for addressing review comments quickly! Would you mind adding a JIRA to ensure our client tests are covering the error cases for listOffsets?
@hachikuji Created KAFKA-4194 to track the tests.
Yep that's it. Just a mistake.
LGTM. I wasn't able to reproduce the failure after applying the fix.
@dguy have a look. Thanks.

@junrao Thank you for the review. Yes, I ran the system tests yesterday and the test results are here: https://jenkins.confluent.io/job/system-test-kafka-branch-builder/550/console. There were 4 unrelated failures. The rest including the quota tests have passed.
Thanks @enothereska LGTM

One general comment. `InternalTopicManager` isn't really doing anything anymore. I left this comment on the previous PR:

> I'm wondering if a lot of this code should be in StreamsKafkaClient or perhaps remove StreamsKafkaClient completely and construct the underlying NetworkClient in InternalTopicManager. If the functionality is something we can/will use elsewhere then I'd put it in StreamsKafkaClient

It seems to me that they should be merged into a single class? @guozhangwang, thoughts?
The change LGTM. Left a comment regarding the API, but not relevant to this PR.

@mimaison, with the feature freeze in place, this is one of the main bugs we want to get in for 0.10.1.0. Could you please merge trunk into this branch? KIP-79 made some changes to the list offsets request so it may need some updates. Sorry about that. :(
